variants.Description in input context: Destabilizing L166P point mutation leads to loss of the cytoprotective DJ-1 protein.

M26I mutation reduces DJ-1 expression; homozygous M26I mutation causes loss of DJ-1 protein. [M26I]DJ-1 binds to aberrant C-terminal site(s), fails to suppress ASK1 activity, and does not promote cytoprotection.
C106A mutation abolishes binding to ASK1 and cytoprotective activity of DJ-1. DJ-1 recruitment into ASK1 signalosome via Cys-106-linked mixed disulfides is disrupted.
C46A mutation of peripheral redox site leads to constitutive ASK1 binding but retains cytoprotective activity.
C53A mutation of peripheral redox site leads to constitutive ASK1 binding but retains cytoprotective activity.
[C106DD]DJ-1 (higher order oxidation mimicking) non-covalently binds to ASK1 without hydrogen peroxide and confers partial cytoprotection.
